description: A firewall user authentication status trap signifies whether a user
using the pass-through firewall authentication mechanism
has been rejected due to reason specified in the trap.
jnxJsFwAuthUserName is the user.
jnxClientIPAddress is the ip address the user came from.
jnxJsFwAuthServiceDesc specifies the application by
which the authentication was performed.
jnxJsFwAuthReason indicates the reason for failure.

event.Summary: $v3 authentication failed for user $v1 from $v2 due to $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthFailure JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthUserName s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthClientIpAddr a 192.0.2.1 JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthServiceDesc s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthReason s EXAMPLE

description: The name of the user who is attempting or has been authenticated.
variables.name: JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthUserName

description: The authentication client's IP Address.
variables.name: JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthClientIpAddr

description: The service or application name that the enthentication
is performed for: telnet, ftp, http.
variables.name: JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthServiceDesc

description: The reason for the trap being generated: authentication
failure due to: timeout, invalid password, invalid username, etc.
variables.name: JUNIPER-JS-AUTH-MIB::jnxJsFwAuthReason

description: Firewall user authentication service has started.

event.Summary: Firewall user authentication service is up

description: Firewall user authentication service has stopped.

event.Summary: Firewall user authentication service is down

description: Firewall user authentication maximum capacity has been exceeded.
jnxJsFwAuthTotalUsers indicates the total number of users
being authenticated. And it has exceeds the maximum allowable
users.

event.Summary: Firewall user authentication exceeded maximum capacity
